Cache APIïƒ

This section documents the caching system.

CacheManager Classïƒ

Unified cache manager supporting multiple backends.

Unified cache manager supporting multiple backends.

Cleanup cache connections on exit.

CacheConfig Classïƒ

Configuration for cache backends.

class ddf.CacheConfig(backend=CacheBackend.REDIS, ttl=None, enabled=True, memcached_servers=None, redis_host='localhost', redis_port=6379, redis_password=None, redis_db=0, pickle_dir='C:\\\\TEMP\\\\docker_cache')[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Cache configuration.

Parameters:

  • backend (CacheBackend) â€“ Cache backend type

  • ttl (int) â€“ Time to live in seconds

  • enabled (bool) â€“ Enable or disable caching

  • memcached_servers (list) â€“ List of Memcached servers

  • redis_host (str) â€“ Redis server host

  • redis_port (int) â€“ Redis server port

  • redis_password (str) â€“ Redis password

  • redis_db (int) â€“ Redis database number

  • pickle_dir (str) â€“ Directory for pickle cache files

backend: CacheBackend = 'redis'ïƒ
ttl: int = Noneïƒ
enabled: bool = Trueïƒ
memcached_servers: list = Noneïƒ
redis_host: str = 'localhost'ïƒ
redis_port: int = 6379ïƒ
redis_password: str = Noneïƒ
redis_db: int = 0ïƒ
pickle_dir: str = 'C:\\TEMP\\docker_cache'ïƒ
__init__(backend=CacheBackend.REDIS, ttl=None, enabled=True, memcached_servers=None, redis_host='localhost', redis_port=6379, redis_password=None, redis_db=0, pickle_dir='C:\\\\TEMP\\\\docker_cache')ïƒ

CacheBackend Enumïƒ

Available cache backend types.

class ddf.CacheBackend(*values)[source]ïƒ

Bases: Enum

NONE

No caching

PICKLE

File-based pickle cache

MEMCACHED

Memcached with JSON serialization

MEMCACHED_PICKLE

Memcached with pickle serialization

REDIS

Redis with JSON serialization

REDIS_PICKLE

Redis with pickle serialization

NONE = 'none'ïƒ
PICKLE = 'pickle'ïƒ
MEMCACHED = 'memcached'ïƒ
MEMCACHED_PICKLE = 'memcached_pickle'ïƒ
REDIS = 'redis'ïƒ
REDIS_PICKLE = 'redis_pickle'ïƒ

Cache Backend Comparisonïƒ

Pickle Backendïƒ

Advantages:

  • No external dependencies

  • Works offline

  • Simple setup

  • Cross-platform

Disadvantages:

  • Not suitable for multi-process scenarios

  • Slower than in-memory caches

  • No automatic expiration

Use When:

  • Development environment

  • Single-user scenarios

  • No Redis/Memcached available

Redis Backendïƒ

Advantages:

  • Fast in-memory storage

  • Persistent data (optional)

  • Supports expiration (TTL)

  • Multi-process safe

  • Pattern-based invalidation

Disadvantages:

  • Requires Redis server

  • Network overhead

  • Additional dependency

Use When:

  • Production environment

  • Multi-user scenarios

  • Need persistence

  • Need advanced features

Memcached Backendïƒ

Advantages:

  • Very fast

  • Simple protocol

  • Low memory overhead

  • Multi-process safe

Disadvantages:

  • Requires Memcached server

  • No persistence

  • No pattern-based operations

  • Additional dependency

Use When:

  • Need highest performance

  • Donâ€™t need persistence

  • Simple caching needs

Configuration Examplesïƒ

Pickle Backendïƒ

[cache]
backend = pickle
enabled = true
pickle_dir = /tmp/ddf_cache

from ddf import CacheConfig, CacheBackend

config = CacheConfig(
    backend=CacheBackend.PICKLE,
    enabled=True,
    pickle_dir="/tmp/ddf_cache"
)

Redis Backendïƒ

[cache]
backend = redis
enabled = true
ttl = 3600
redis_host = localhost
redis_port = 6379
redis_password = secret
redis_db = 0

from ddf import CacheConfig, CacheBackend

config = CacheConfig(
    backend=CacheBackend.REDIS,
    enabled=True,
    ttl=3600,
    redis_host="localhost",
    redis_port=6379,
    redis_password="secret",
    redis_db=0
)

Memcached Backendïƒ

[cache]
backend = memcached
enabled = true
ttl = 3600
memcached_servers = localhost:11211, 192.168.1.100:11211

from ddf import CacheConfig, CacheBackend

config = CacheConfig(
    backend=CacheBackend.MEMCACHED,
    enabled=True,
    ttl=3600,
    memcached_servers=[
        ('localhost', 11211),
        ('192.168.1.100', 11211)
    ]
)

Usage Examplesïƒ

Basic Cachingïƒ

from ddf import CACHE

# Set value
CACHE.set('key', 'value', ttl=3600)

# Get value
value = CACHE.get('key')

# Delete value
CACHE.delete('key')

Pattern Invalidationïƒ

from ddf import CACHE

# Invalidate all keys starting with prefix
count = CACHE.invalidate_pattern('service:')

print(f"Invalidated {count} keys")

Flush Allïƒ

from ddf import CACHE

# Flush all cache
CACHE.flush_all()

Decorator Usageïƒ

from ddf import cache_with_invalidation

@cache_with_invalidation(ttl=3600, key_prefix='myfunction')
def my_expensive_function(arg1, arg2):
    # Expensive computation
    return result

Performance Tipsïƒ

  1. Use TTL wisely: Set appropriate expiration times

  2. Pattern invalidation: Use prefixes for related keys

  3. Serialization: Use pickle for complex objects, JSON for simple ones

  4. Connection pooling: Redis/Memcached handle this automatically

  5. Monitoring: Check cache hit rates regularly

Troubleshootingïƒ

Cache Not Workingïƒ

# Check cache is enabled
from ddf import CACHE_CONFIG
print(f"Cache enabled: {CACHE_CONFIG.enabled}")
print(f"Cache backend: {CACHE_CONFIG.backend}")

Connection Errorsïƒ

# Test cache connectivity
from ddf import CACHE

try:
    CACHE.set('test', 'value')
    value = CACHE.get('test')
    print(f"Cache working: {value == 'value'}")
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Cache error: {e}")

For more information, see Caching System.
